description: The government of Saint Lucia will not allow any non-national with a travel history within the last 14 days from Mainland China, (whether in- transit or originating), to enter any local port as of 12 a.m. on Feb. 4, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_what: Foreign Residents (Foreign Nationals Residing in the Country)

description: The government of Saint Lucia will not allow any non-national with a travel history within the last 14 days from Hong Kong, Republic of Korea, Japan, Italy, and Singapore, (whether in- transit or originating), to enter any local port as of 12 a.m. on Feb. 26, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_what: Foreign Residents (Foreign Nationals Residing in the Country)

description: The government of Saint Lucia will not allow any non-national with a travel history within the last 14 days from Spain, Mainland France, Germany, Iran, and the United Kingdom, (whether in- transit or originating), to enter any local port as of Mar. 17, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_what: Foreign Residents (Foreign Nationals Residing in the Country)

description: The Government of Saint Lucia announces the closure of Saint Lucia’s airports to all incoming commercial and private flights effective 11:59 p.m. on Monday, March 23, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The Government of Saint Lucia has announced a phased approach to reopening the island’s tourism sector in a responsible fashion, beginning June 4, 2020. Minister Fedee said the phased approach to reopening, which continues through July 31, 2020, resulted from national COVID-19 Task Force consultations with on-island industry stakeholders.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description: 9 July, 2020, new Protocols Include Mandatory COVID-19 Pre-Test within 7 Days of Travel, exemptions for Visitors Traveling from Designated ‘Travel Bubble’ and Pre-Arrival Online Registration UPDATE: Visitors within the Bubble Countries with a travel history from these areas in the last 21 days will be exempt from quarantine; however, they are required to obtain a Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) Negative test result no more than seven (7) days prior to date of travel, and are subject to mandatory screening on arrival.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Effective Wednesday, February 3rd, 2021, visitors to St Lucia would now require a PCR test taken within five days of arrival instead of seven days.Travelers aged 18 and over must also complete a Travel Registration seven days or more before travel, as well as a Health Screening Form. Passengers in transit with a same-day onward journey do not require travel authorization.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The Saint Lucia Ministry of Health has activated three respiratory clinics, effective March 16, 2020. (announced on March 18 by Prime Minister)

description: Saint Lucians are encouraged to prepare households in the event of a possible outbreak of COVID-19 in the community. (on March 23)

description: Mandatory quarantine for travelers from China. Any national returning to Saint Lucia from China with similar travel history, will be quarantined for 14 days. Quarantine centers have been set up using various hotels to facilitate the large numbers of returning nationals and any non-nationals that may arrive of concern. All persons in quarantine are provided with breakfast, lunch and dinner.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)

description: Mandatory quarantine for nationals returning from Spain, Mainland France, Germany, Iran and the United Kingdom, Mainland China, Hong Kong, the Republic of Korea, Japan, Italy, and Singapore will be quarantined for 14 days. Quarantine centers have been set up using various hotels to facilitate the large numbers of returning nationals and any non-nationals that may arrive of concern. All persons in quarantine are provided with breakfast, lunch and dinner. UPDATE: Home quarantine in situations where individuals have health complications, small children, are unable to function independently, and other sensitive situations. Inspection of homes by health officials prior to approval are. necessary.

description: All returning Saint Lucia citizens and residents must also complete the Pre-Arrival registration form. On arrival, they are required to quarantine for 14 days at a pre-approved home quarantine address, Government operated quarantine facility or a COVID-19 certified property. UPDATE: Anyone arriving without proof of a negative PCR test will be subject to immediate isolation and testing with possible quarantine or treatment should a passenger test positive - at their own cost.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)

description: Effective October 15, 2020, those who have received a negative PCR result and meet the criteria to thereafter be quarantined at home as determined by the Health Authorities, would be granted permission to do so. 14-day Home Quarantine will apply strictly to minors, persons with health conditions and those with specific conditions. These individuals will also be required to wear the electronic monitoring devices at the abovementioned cost.

description: November 19, given that the quarantine period for Atlantic Rally for Cruisers (ARC) events will be observed with a minimum of 14 days, COVID-19 PCR testing upon arrival in Saint Lucia will be conducted as necessary and as determined by Port Health Authorities.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Visitors who, immediately before arriving in St. Lucia, were in a Bubble Country for at least 21 days are considered Bubble Travelers and will be exempt from quarantine; however, they must have a negative result from a PCR test taken no more than 7 days before arriving in Saint Lucia, and are subject to mandatory screening on arrival.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_country: Antigua and Barbuda,Barbados,Dominica,Grenada,Other (please specify below),Saint Kitts and Nevis,Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People of a certain age (please note age range in the text entry)

description: As of Jan. 21, 2021, marine Arrivals: For travelers from outside the CARICOM Travel Bubble, if fewer than 14 days are spent at sea, the remainder of the 14-day quarantine period must be observed at anchor, at a designated quarantine dock, or in a COVID-19 certified property in accordance with marine protocols. Persons on vessels arriving at night must remain on board until the following morning when they will be checked by Port Health authorities.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
